site-description: The Ethereum Ecosystem Support Program provides financial and non-financial support for projects working to accelerate the growth of Ethereum.
find-us: Find us at these community events!
newsletter-description: Sign up to receive ESP updates to your inbox! You'll hear from us every few weeks, and we'll only ever contact you with ESP news.
subscribe: Subscribe to the ESP Newsletter? You'll hear from us every few weeks, and we'll only ever contact you with ESP news.

help.question: What can Ecosystem Support help with?
help.answer-p-1: To give you an idea of what the Ecosystem Support Program can do for you, here is a non-exhaustive list of some of the ways we have helped other applicants.
help.answer-li-3: Facilitated collaborations with other teams and individuals
help.answer-li-5: Connected projects to community members in the same geographical area
help.answer-li-6: Connected projects to others working in the same topic area
help.answer-li-7: Facilitated project participation in events (hackathons, conferences, etc.) to meet the community, showcase work, and get feedback
help.answer-li-8: Provided introduction to other funding programs
help.answer-p-3: We are still expanding the scope of our support, so if what you’re looking for is not on this list, please get in touch and let us know what you need!

grant.question: Does the Ecosystem Support Program still give grants?
grant.answer-p-1: Yes! Awarding grants continues to be an important tool for us; but impact often takes more than just money, so we/ve expanded the range of support we provide. Our goal is to take an individual approach to each project, working together to establish realistic goals and offering support targeted to facilitate those goals.

eligibility.question: Who can apply?
eligibility.answer-p-1: We don’t accept grant applications directly through our website, but rather invite interested parties to get in touch through our
eligibility.answer-p-2: Newcomers to Ethereum, established projects, and past grantees are all welcome to submit an inquiry. Consider this inquiry the start of a conversation, and we’ll help you decide whether applying for a grant or other support is the right next step for you.

eligibility-2.question: Is anyone *not* eligible for the Ecosystem Support Program?
eligibility-2.answer-p-1: Anyone is welcome to apply for support, but the specific types of support available may vary. We typically provide grants funding for proposals that provide open-source software, research, community building or other contributions expected to have a positive impact on the ecosystem and community as a whole. We are happy to work with for-profit entities that are contributing to the Ethereum ecosystem, although clearly commercial projects (including any project that has recently raised or plans to raise ICO or venture investment) are likely to be better suited to receive non-financial support.
eligibility-2.answer-p-2: Even if your overall project or business is not eligible for grant funding, it’s still worth getting in touch! We may be able to provide other types of assistance, and in some cases specific subcomponents or research challenges may be eligible for financial support.

topics.question: What types of projects are you interested in?
topics.answer-p-1: Some areas we’ve focused on so far include:
topics.answer-li-1: Research (e.g. cryptography, MPC computational models, privacy, proof systems, Eth2 challenges)
topics.answer-li-2: Protocol improvements (e.g optimisations, contributions to sharding, light clients)
topics.answer-li-3: L2 solutions (e.g. Plasma, State channels, Rollup)
topics.answer-li-4: Community resources (e.g. documentation, tutorials, forums, groups, outreach)
topics.answer-li-5: Open source tooling (e.g IDEs, testing tools, static analysis tools, debuggers)
topics.answer-li-6: Public good infrastructure (e.g. messaging, storage, compute)
topics.answer-li-7: Interoperability (e.g. with other protocols and services)
topics.answer-p-2: More generally, we look for transformational concepts, broad impact, and initiatives that address clear needs in the ecosystem. Don’t feel constrained by these lists - thinking outside the box is encouraged!

applications.question: What makes a good application?
applications.answer-p-1: While we don’t take grant applications directly through our website, thorough and thoughtful responses to the questions on our inquiry form can start the process off right. When submitting an inquiry, we want to know who you are, what you’re trying to do and what issues you’re facing.
applications.answer-p-2: Adding detailed information to your inquiry will increase your chances of getting a useful and timely response. Some common causes of delay include:
applications.answer-li-1: Unclear impact (insufficient focus on how your project would help the Ethereum ecosystem)
applications.answer-li-2: Unclear project description (insufficient technical description of what you are building)
applications.answer-li-3: Unclear needs/challenges (insufficient reflection on what stands between you and your goals)
applications.answer-p-3: We need enough information to understand your goals, your motivation and your challenges. The more detail you provide at this stage, the more likely we’ll be able to help.

millions.question: Will you give me a million dollars?
millions.answer-p-1: Probably not. Grant sizes vary widely depending on the scope and expected length of the project - anywhere from $5,000 USD for an individual tackling a distinct task or research problem, to $200k+ for dedicated Eth 2 client teams working on a multi-year timeline. Grant applicants will have the opportunity to work with the ESP team on determining an appropriate request based on the scope of their proposed work.

application-process.question: What happens after an inquiry is submitted?
application-process.answer-p-1: You’ll be assigned a guide, who will be a consistent point of contact to help you navigate the process. There will be an initial conversation and peer review to determine whether the program is a good fit for your project and what types of support might be most appropriate. If it seems like a fit, you’ll enter the next phase of formally applying for a grant, exploring other resources, or both. Whichever track(s) you embark on, your guide will be with you every step of the way. The more detail you provide in your initial inquiry, the smoother and quicker the process of determining next steps can go. See “What makes a good application” above for more on this.

response-time.question: How long will it take before I hear back from you?
response-time.answer-p-1: You should hear from us within a few days of submitting your inquiry. If your inquiry progresses to a grant application, the overall process may take a few weeks to a few months depending on the scope and complexity of your project. You can help us move the process along by providing as much detail as possible in your initial inquiry (see 'What makes a good application' above).

confidentiality.question: Is my application confidential?
confidentiality.answer-p-1: Any information you provide may be shared in the peer-review process, so let us know in your application if there's anything you want us to keep private!

payment.question: Can grants be paid out in ETH?
payment.answer-p-1: We can provide payment in ETH, DAI, or Fiat currency.

page-home.title: Home
page-home.p-1: The Ecosystem Support Program exists to provide both financial and non-financial support to projects and entities within the greater Ethereum community, in order to accelerate the growth of the ecosystem. The Ecosystem Support Program is an expansion of the original Ethereum Grants Program which mainly focused on financial support. Our focus is on deploying our resources where they will have the biggest impact.
page-home.p-2: If you've got a project and want to see if ESP is a good fit
page-home.contact-us-desc: Are you working on a specific project, or are you still exploring possibilities to get involved?

page-wishlist.title: Wishlist
page-wishlist.description: The Ethereum Ecosystem Support Program provides financial and non-financial support for projects working to accelerate the growth of Ethereum.
page-wishlist.h2-description: Here, you’ll find some of the areas where we’re actively seeking applications. While these are some of the most pressing needs we see in the ecosystem, the list is by no means exhaustive. We don't expect to think of everything - we’re always looking for new ideas. If you’re working on something that will make Ethereum better,

h2-capabilities.answer-p-1: Decentralized data storage, indexing, data privacy, and associated tooling. Use cases including:
h2-capabilities.answer-li-3: Storage and retrieval of Ethereum history
h2-capabilities.comm-info: Privacy preserving communication at network and messaging layers. Use cases including:
h2-capabilities.infrastructure: Infrastructure and standards for decentralized applications
h2-capabilities.infra-info: Frameworks, standards and missing infrastructure which improve developer productivity, and/or help fulfill the vision of decentralized applications.
h2-capabilities.id-info: Digital identity building blocks, standards and tooling. Use cases including:
h2-capabilities.integration-info: Integration and interoperability with other systems and standards including:
h2-capabilities.answer-li-15: Other important protocols, software stacks, and hardware platforms.
h2-capabilities.answer-d-1: Eth 1.x and Eth 2 light client research and development; other approaches to ensuring secure data availability for resource constrained devices and libraries.

h2-privacy.comm-info-2: Privacy preserving communication at network and messaging layers. Use cases including:
h2-privacy.execution-info: Approaches towards confidential execution and transfers including:
h2-privacy.cryptography-info: Cryptographic research, constructions, improved implementations, and libraries.

h2-security.smart-contract-info: Techniques, tools and best practices for preventing, detecting and mitigating vulnerabilities.
h2-security.game-theory-info: Research into game theoretic and crypto economic aspects for example, theory of open games or miner extractable value.
h2-security.monitoring-info: Network and smart contract monitoring tools.

h2-usability.answer-d-1: Removing usability barriers and other impediments to adoption and use.
h2-usability.mgmt-info: Key management improvements including portability between wallets, social and other key recovery mechanisms.

h2-dev-exp.dec-infra: Infrastructure and standards for decentralized applications
h2-dev-exp.dec-infra-info: Frameworks, standards and missing infrastructure which improve developer productivity, and/or help fulfill the vision of decentralized applications.
h2-dev-exp.tooling-info: Tools and libraries that improve developer experience, productivity, code quality and safety.
h2-dev-exp.contract-security-info: Techniques, tools and best practices for preventing, detecting and mitigating vulnerabilities.
h2-dev-exp.monitoring-tools-info: Network and smart contract monitoring tools.

h2-edu-comm.edu-materials-info: Improved documentation; tutorials; common resources like educational toolkits that can be shared between events and courses.
h2-edu-comm.translation-info: Translating documentation, educational material, research, and specs into other languages.
h2-edu-comm.events-info: Growing the Ethereum community, especially in currently underrepresented regions; creating links with valued aligned communities and expert groups.

h2-scaling.cryptography-info: Cryptographic research, constructions, improved implementations, and libraries.
h2-scaling.l2-info: Shared infrastructure and standards for L2 scaling solutions; research into cross shard L2; general L2 scaling research; development of L2 scaling solutions.

h2-eth1x.stateless-info: Research into stateless Ethereum with application to both Eth 1.x and Eth 2, including:

h2-eth2.confidential-info: Approaches towards confidential execution and transfers including:
h2-eth2.stateless-eth2-info: Research into stateless Ethereum with application to both Eth 1.x and Eth 2, including:

h2-innovate.innovate-info: Breakthough ideas, projects, improvements, research challenges we don't even know we need!

page-explore.title: Explore Inquiry
page-explore.description: Tell us a bit about yourself, your skills, what you're excited about, and what questions you have. We only collect the following information submitted below and will not use or share for any purposes other than evaluation.
page-explore.name: Your name
page-explore.name-guide: Use whichever preferred name you would like our team to address you by.
page-explore.proj-info: What's the name of the project you’re currently working on? This is optional.
page-explore.profile-info: Tell us a little bit about yourself - whatever you think we should know.
page-explore.expertise-info: What is unique about your skill set? What kinds of problems do you enjoy solving?
page-explore.proj-dev: What's a project or development that you were excited about recently?
page-explore.link-2-work: Please provide links to published code, research, or other documentation of what you're working on.
page-explore.questions: What questions can we answer for you?
page-explore.country: What country are you located in?
page-explore.city: What city are you located in?
page-explore.support: How did you hear about Ecosystem Support?
page-explore.support-info: Did anyone recommend that you contact Ecosystem Support? If so, who?

page-project.title: Project Inquiry
page-project.description: Tell us a bit about your project goals, motivations, needs, challenges, and any other information you feel is pertinent for us to know. You'll hear back from someone on the Ecosystem Support team very soon! We only collect the following information submitted below and will not use or share for any purposes other than evaluation.
page-project.proj-success: What are you working on? What does success look like for your project? (2-3 short paragraphs)
page-project.team: Who are the members of your team? Please write or link to bios.
page-project.proj-impact: What key problem or need do you hope to address? How will your work impact the larger Ethereum ecosystem? Who will benefit from your work?
page-project.challenges-info: What are the most significant obstacles facing your project or your team right now? What are some of your most pressing needs?
page-project.prev-work-links: Please provide links to published code, research, or other documentation of what you're working on.
page-project.contact-p-country: Where is your contact person based (country)?
page-project.contact-p-city: Where is your contact person based (city)?
page-project.support: How did you hear about Ecosystem Support?
page-project.support-p: Did anyone recommend that you contact Ecosystem Support? If so, who?

page-projects.title: Featured Projects
page-projects.p: This is only a small sample – we’ll highlight a few at a time and rotate periodically, so make sure to check back once in a while for updates. We’ll feature projects that have had at least a few months since receiving support, so that we have some results to look back on as well as ongoing trajectory and remaining milestones.
page-projects.description: Get to know some of the projects that ESP is currently supporting!

page-404.title: Page not found
page-404.body: You just hit a route that doesn't exist... the sadness.

page-thanks.title: Thanks
page-thanks.p-1: Your inquiry has been successfully submitted! The Ecosystem Support team will be reaching out within the next few business days with detailed information.
page-thanks.p-2: Until then, kick back and relax.
